column4: anyone, I installed the default install, how do I get it so the gui doesnt automatically start?
will that still allow startx to run the gui?
yes, it just wont start the display managers automatically, you could still start them with /etc/init.d/gdm start
ok, is that a command that has to happen with sudo, or do I need to edit a text?
both commands i told you require superuser access
its saying "sudo: remove: command not found
you need to remove the file in /etc/rc2.d that starts the display manager
why wont it allow me to delete or remove that file?
it says del and remove are not found in command line
sorry, not used to linux any more
